verses.name: Proverbs 29:7
verses.text: The righteous considereth the cause of the poor: but the wicked regardeth not to know it.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:8
verses.text: Scornful men bring a city into a snare: but wise men turn away wrath.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:9
verses.text: If a wise man contendeth with a foolish man, whether he rage or laugh, there is no rest.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:10
verses.text: The bloodthirsty hate the upright: but the just seek his soul.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:11
verses.text: A fool uttereth all his mind: but a wise man keepeth it in till afterwards.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:12
verses.text: If a ruler hearken to lies, all his servants are wicked.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:13
verses.text: The poor and the deceitful man meet together: the Lord lighteneth both their eyes.
